Class Diary

  • java.lang.Object
    • Diary

  • public class Diary
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an employees diary. Contains all meetings an employee has.
    Author:
    Ryan Crampton, Christian Hegarty, Tom Smith

      • searchWithDateTime

        public void searchWithDateTime(java.lang.String editOrDelete)
        This allows the user to search for the undo, edit or delete work with this
        Parameters:
        dateString - This detects the user input
        sc - This is the scanner, detects input
        date - This parses the info gained in date string to a LocalDate Input
        timeString - This parses info to time, String type
        time - This parses information gained in the previous string to LocalTime format
        maxSize - This checks the size of the meetings located in the linked list, returns an int
        search - This looks for the meeting and holds the meeting that it is appropriate to
        meetings - This is the LinkedList that holds all the meetings for the user
        editOrDelete - This holds the info from the inputted info the user got earlier

      • editMeeting

        public void editMeeting(Meeting editMeeting)
        This allows the user to search for the undo, edit or delete work with this
        Parameters:
        tempDate - This holds the current date of the meeting
        tempStart - This holds the current start time of the meeting
        tempEnd - This hold the current end time of the meeting
        tempDescription - This holds the current description for the meeting
        meetings - This is the LinkedList that holds all the meetings for the user
        stop - This is done at the end when the user confirms they have finished all edits
        editHappened - This determines if an edit has happened to the meeting, and confirms to the user it has
        newMeeting - This puts back in the edited node
        partEdited - This determines which part needs editing, depending on user input
        partEditedString - This is where the user inputs the new info
        formattedDateEdit - This edits the date to the appropriate format
        edit - This edits the node
        valid - This confirms if the edits are valid or not
        Y - This checks if the user wants to keep editing, if Y or y is input, they do

      • deleteMeeting

        public void deleteMeeting(Meeting deletedMeeting)
        This deletes a meeting from the List
        Parameters:
        meetings - This is the LinkedList that holds all the users meetings
        deletedMeeting - This allows the meeting to be deleted, passed on from the previous user inputs
        undoStack - Holds the meeting incase the user wants to undo

      • checkIfValid

        public boolean checkIfValid(Meeting meeting)
        This checks if it is possible for the meeting to be added, returns true or false
        Parameters:
        start - This determines the nodes start time
        end - This determines the nodes end time
        day - This determines the date of the meeting
        clash - This determines the amount of clashes in the data, if one is found it cannot add it
        meetings - This is the LinkedList that holds all the meetings for the appropriate user
        x - This is the iterator for the for loop
        timeS - This is from the node in the meetings, compares start time
        timeE - This is from the node in the meetings, compares end time
        date - This is from the node that holds meeting info. this is the date of it
        hold - This acts as a means to save the meeting while its being checked
        clashes - This acts as a mechanism if a meeting already exists, this will refuse to add it if its there
        Returns:
        true or false

        This prints the meetings to the user
        Parameters:
        entryToPrint - This is the node it is printing to the user, gathers all info
        iterator - This allows the nodes to check if there is more, and gather that info

        public void undo()
        This allows the system to decide what to undo, depending on the input
        Parameters:
        undoStack - This is used to determine what stack needs undoing
        undoMeeting - This is used to determine the meetings origin, and what happened to it

      • checkIfValidForMultiple

        public java.util.ArrayList<Meeting> checkIfValidForMultiple(Employee held,
                                                            java.util.ArrayList<Meeting> theMeetingsList)
        This checks if it is possible for the meeting to be added, returns true or false
        Parameters:
        start - This determines the nodes start time
        end - This determines the nodes end time
        day - This determines the date of the meeting
        meeting - This gets the meeting from the list of arrays, gets all the info for them
        clash - This determines the amount of clashes in the data, if one is found it cannot add it
        meetings - This is the LinkedList that holds all the meetings for the appropriate user
        x - This is the iterator for the for loop
        x1 - This is the iterator for the for loop
        timeS - This is from the node in the meetings, compares start time
        timeE - This is from the node in the meetings, compares end time
        date - This is from the node that holds meeting info. this is the date of it
        hold - This acts as a means to save the meeting while its being checked
        theMeetingList - This holds all the info on the possible meetings, and holds them in an ArrayList
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all possible meetings
